instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2442: What is A2442? A2442 is a model number for a 14 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2021 M1 with EMC 3650, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02098..
definitions.820-02098: What is 820-02098? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot but no charge
threads.message:
Hello,

I got an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with some liquid damages. After some replacements it boots fine, but won't charge. The magsafe light is orange but no charge, and none of the usb c will charge it.
I tried dfu restore successfully but it still won't charge. 
Where should I start ?

Thanks for helping,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot but no charge
threads.message: You should try with known good battery first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot but no charge
threads.message: Thanks for your response. I don't have another battery to try. But the board won't boot without battery. The battery discharge function well. The board should boot without battery with magsafe and usb c but it doesn't.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot but no charge
threads.message: Trackpad clics wen battery is disconnected and magsafe light is orange. But the board is not booting

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot but no charge
threads.message:
" But the board won't boot without battery."
You didn't mention that in first post.
I was thinking machine was already tested with charger alone.

So battery is recognized and macOS correctly shows its percentage?
Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> voltages with charger alone (without battery).

Check voltage on pads 3, 5, 7, 9, 11 of J5101.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot but no charge
threads.message:
Sorry for that.
Yes battery is recognized and shows correct percentage.
With magsafe only :
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> 11.98v
<SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> 3.78v
J5101 :
3 1.23V
5 0V
7 0V
9 0V
11 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot but no charge
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5101</RESISTOR>/02 not soldered?

Pin 3 denotes a problem on USB-C area.
Check <SIGNAL>UPC_I2C_INT_L</SIGNAL> too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot but no charge
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5101</RESISTOR>/02 no soldered.
<SIGNAL>UPC_I2C_INT_L</SIGNAL> 0V.
<SIGNAL>USBC2_AUXLSX_N</SIGNAL> broken pad under ug400, is that a problem for the board to boot without battery ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot but no charge
threads.message:
Not sure what this bus is used for.
You should to rebuild broken trace.
M1 requires high level on <SIGNAL>UPC_I2C_INT_L</SIGNAL> line.
